definition[0]: to enter a building or car by using force, in order to steal something
example[0]: Someone broke into my car and stole the radio.
example[1]: Her house was broken into last week.
definition[1]: to become involved in a new job or business activity
example[2]: She made an attempt to break into journalism.
example[3]: It’s a profession that is very hard to break into.
example[4]: Many British firms have failed in their attempts to break into the American market.
definition[2]: to start to spend money that you did not want to spend
example[5]: I don’t want to break into my savings unless I have to.
example[6]: He broke into a run as he came round the corner.
definition[4]: to suddenly start smiling, singing etc
example[7]: Her face broke into a smile.
example[8]: The audience broke into loud applause.
